summary: papain family cysteine proteases are critical to pathogenicity of many microorganisms. many bacteria secrete several nonspecific proteases e.g. Pseudomonas, Serratia, Clostridium, Candida, Bacteroides, Porphyromonas and Staphylococcus sp. cystatin superfamily of proteins comprises both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cysteine protease inhibitors [7] human cystatins C, D and S, rat cystatins A and S, chicken cystatin and oryza cystatin have been reported to inhibit the replication of certain viruses and bacteria. the key role of cysteine proteases in microbial infections coupled with the relative lack of redundancy compared to mammalian systems has made m d pyridylimidazo[1,5-a]pyridine derivatives as a potent and novel cysteine protease inhibitors which acts as antibacterial agents. papain (EC 3.4.22.2) and Bz-DL-Arg-pNA (BAPNA) were purchased from Sigma Chemical Co., St. Louis, MO, USA. a grid box of 606060 was generated around active site of papain. the number of docking runs was set to 10. each docking was repeated five times, having in the end a total of 50 docking runs. ten derivatives of 1-pyridylimidazo[1,5-a]pyridine were synthesized according to siddiqui et al., 2006 [22]. ten derivatives of 1-pyridylimidazo[1,5-a]pyridine were synthesized according to the results of docking studies. the capacity of the 1-substituted Pyridylimidazo[1,5-a]pyridine derivatives to inhibit cysteine proteases was tested using papain as the model enzyme. the proteolytic activity of the reaction mixtures was determined using Bz-DL-Arg-pNA as the model enzyme. in against 1- substituted pyridylimidazo[1,5-a] pyridine derivatives (G) were determined by the equation. Temperature dependence of the inhibition constants was used to determine the thermodynamic parameters. DMSO was taken as negative control and Ceftriaxone and clotrimazole were taken as positive control. the MICs were taken as the lowest inhibitor concentration at which the bacterial growth was inhibited. the average of three values was calculated and that was the MIC for the test material and bacterial strain. microbes Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC-25923; Proteus vulgaris); Bacillus spp. (ATCC-14593); Klebsiella pneumonia (ATCC-13883); Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC-13883); Serratia morganii (ATCC-31665) were obtained from Sigma Chemical Co., St. Louis, MO, USA. a grid box of 606060 was generated around active site of papain making sure those inhibitors can freely rotate inside the grid. each docking was repeated five times, having in the end a total of 50 docking runs, to check the precision of results. the docked complexes were then visualized using PyMol. 1-(2-pyridyl)-3-(2-hydroxyphenyl) imidazo[1,5-a]pyridine (3a); 1-(2-pyridyl)-3-(2-chlorophenyl) imidazo[1,5-a]pyridine (3c); 1-(2-pyridyl)-3-(2-methylphenyl)imidazo[1,5-a]pyridine (3h); 1-(2-Pyridyl)-3-(3-me 1-pyridylimidazo[1,5-a]pyridine derivatives to inhibit cysteine proteases was tested using papain as the model enzyme. the proteolytic activity of the reaction mixtures was determined by the equation. the assay was done at different temperatures (32°C, 37°C, 42°C) calculating various Ki of 1-pyridylimidazo[1,5-a]pyridine derivatives with papain as model enzyme.
